featureSplit.utils

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • featureSplit.utils.View

  • public class View
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents one view of the data - a subset of the complete feature set that describes the data

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      View(int viewNo)
      Creates a new instance of the view

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFeature(Feature feature)
      Adds a feature to the view
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compares two views based on the feature set they contain.
      boolean featureInView(Feature feature)
      Checks whether the view contains the feature
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getFeatureIndices()
      Returns the indices (original feature indices in the dataset that contains features from all views) of the features in this view
      java.util.Set<Feature> getFeatures()
      Returns the set of features in the view
      int getViewNo()
      Returns the view number in the feature split (one feature split contains multiple views)
      int hashCode()
      Generates the hashCode based on the feature set the view contains.

        public void addFeature(Feature feature)
        Adds a feature to the view
        Parameters:

      • featureInView

        public boolean featureInView(Feature feature)
        Checks whether the view contains the feature
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature to look for
        Returns:
        true if feature belongs to the view, false otherwise

      • getViewNo

        public int getViewNo()
        Returns the view number in the feature split (one feature split contains multiple views)

        view number in the feature split

      • getFeatures

        public java.util.Set<Feature> getFeatures()
        Returns the set of features in the view

        the set of features in the view

      • getFeatureIndices

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getFeatureIndices()
        Returns the indices (original feature indices in the dataset that contains features from all views) of the features in this view
        Returns:
        the indices of the features from the view

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Generates the hashCode based on the feature set the view contains. Does not consider the number of the view - the two views that contain the exact same feature subset are equal, although their assigned numbers may be different
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares two views based on the feature set they contain. The two views that contain the exact same feature subset are equal, although their indexes may be different
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
